benchmark_details.name: ACEBench
benchmark_details.overview: ACEBench is a comprehensive benchmark for assessing tool usage in Large Language Models (LLMs), categorizing data into three primary types based on evaluation methodology: Normal, Special, and Agent, and aims to address limitations in existing benchmarks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the tool usage capabilities of LLMs through a comprehensive framework covering various scenarios and fine-grained evaluation metrics.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The quality of generated data may not completely reflect real-world applications, and the manual construction of Agent data may limit diversity.

data.source: Automatically generated by LLMs and curated expert data construction.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by experts and automatically generated.

methodology.calculation: Overall Accuracy is computed as a weighted sum of the accuracies for Normal, Special, and Agent data types.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better tool usage capabilities in evaluated models.
methodology.validation: Extensive experimental validation across multiple LLMs.
